macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stock Markets Mixed: Dow Up 0.5%, S&P and Nasdaq Down on Tech Weakness
items.summary: The Dow Jones rose 0.5% to 49,501.30, while the S&P 500 fell 0.5% to 6,882.72 and Nasdaq dropped 1.5% to 22,904.58 amid declines in tech sectors like XLK (-2.2%). Energy (XLE +3.2%) and materials led gains; VIX rose 3.6% to 18.64.[1]

items.title: S&P 500 and Nasdaq Hit 2026 Lows After Weak Layoff Data
items.summary: Major indexes declined sharply in early trading with S&P 500 (-1.01%) and Nasdaq (-0.91%) at 2026 lows, led by tech giants Amazon (-3.47%), Alphabet (-2.94%), and Microsoft (-2.72%). Labor data showed higher jobless claims, more layoffs, and fewer openings.[2]

items.title: Kevin Warsh Fed Chair Nomination Adds Uncertainty to Markets
items.summary: Markets react to Kevin Warsh’s nomination as next Fed Chair (pending Senate confirmation), contributing to risk asset declines amid tech outflows despite record earnings. Equity indexes show divergence with defensive sectors gaining.[3]

items.title: Sector Rotation: Energy and Defensive Stocks Outperform Tech Slump
items.summary: Energy Select Sector SPDR (XLE) surged 3.2%, Materials (XLB) +2.1%, Consumer Staples (XLP) +1.6%, and Utilities (XLU) +1.5%, while Tech (XLK -2.2%), Communication (XLC -1.6%), and Health Care (XLV -1%) fell.[1]

items.title: Dow Holds Key Support Levels Amid Broader Market Pullback
items.summary: Dow Jones maintains resilience on higher timeframes with support at 48,600-49,700; Nasdaq weaker in 24,000-26,000 range after failing all-time highs.[3]

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Crashes Below $70K in Early February 2026
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below $70,000 due to high correlation with tech stocks (0.5 with S&P 500), dominance of CME futures (20-25% of global derivatives), and Wall Street's influence turning it into a traditional asset. Analysts outline scenarios including recovery to $85K-$90K, ranging $60K-$75K, or crash to $40K-$50K.

items.title: Bitcoin Nears or Surpasses 2021 All-Time High on February 5, 2026
items.summary: Live stream discussion highlights Bitcoin reaching or exceeding its previous 2021 all-time high, amid ongoing cryptocurrency market analysis.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Impulse AI Launches No-Code Autonomous Machine Learning Platform
items.summary: Impulse AI announced an autonomous ML platform enabling teams to build, deploy, and monitor production-grade AI models without coding. The platform's AI agent ranked in the top 2.5% of a Kaggle competition, demonstrating performance matching human ML engineers.

items.title: Expert Intelligence Secures $5.8M in Seed Funding for Laboratory Automation
items.summary: Expert Intelligence announced $5.8 million in seed funding led by Sierra Ventures to automate regulated laboratory workflows. The company's Limited Sample Model uses machine learning to reduce data interpretation time from days or weeks to hours in pharmaceutical and drug development settings.

items.title: AI Chip Market Projected to Reach $1.10 Trillion by 2035
items.summary: The global AI chip market is expected to grow from $121.73 billion in 2026 to $1.10 trillion by 2035, driven by demand for custom ASICs and edge AI processing. Recent developments include Hyundai's launch of Edge Brain chips and Qualcomm's AI 250 and AI200 inference solutions.

items.title: Cellular Intelligence Develops Foundation Model for Stem Cell Therapies
items.summary: Researchers at Harvard Medical School co-founded Cellular Intelligence to build a foundation model that improves predictability and scalability of cell replacement therapies. The machine-learning system aims to reveal underlying rules guiding cell development for more reliable therapeutic outcomes.

items.title: Enterprise AI Focus Shifts from Generative Models to Production Infrastructure
items.summary: At AI & Big Data Expo 2026 in London, enterprise leaders emphasized that successful AI deployment requires strong data foundations, compliance frameworks, and infrastructure for observability and monitoring. Early excitement over generative models is fading as companies face integration challenges.

items.title: UN Establishes Independent International Scientific Panel on AI Governance
items.summary: UN Secretary-General announced the creation of an Independent International Scientific Panel on Artificial Intelligence to build shared understandings and effective guardrails for AI development. The panel's first report is expected in July to inform global AI governance discussions.

items.title: Study Shows Which Job Tasks Are Most Vulnerable to AI Automation
items.summary: Research from King's College London and the AI Objectives Institute found that occupations with large numbers of tasks exposed to AI automation, such as basic administration and data entry, experienced a 6.1% decline in job postings following ChatGPT's release.

items.title: Bounteous Launches Claude Code Lab Series with Anthropic
items.summary: Bounteous announced a hands-on workshop series in partnership with Anthropic to accelerate responsible AI adoption, building on innovation in AI, machine learning, agentic systems, and generative technologies.

items.title: Walmart Invests in AI to Transform Retail Operations
items.summary: Walmart is establishing a new executive group focused on using artificial intelligence to transform its retail operations and increase internal efficiency.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Ghost of Yotei Outperforms Ghost of Tsushima, Boosting Sony Financials
items.summary: Sony confirmed that Ghost of Yotei exceeded expectations by outperforming its predecessor Ghost of Tsushima over the same period, bolstering the company's financials. This success highlights strong performance in Sony's gaming division.

items.title: Yoroll.ai Announces First Engine-less Game Platform Powered by World Models
items.summary: Yoroll.ai is building the first engine-less game platform leveraging Google's Genie 3 world model for real-time interactive video and branching narratives, drastically reducing production costs for cinematic experiences.

items.title: PlayStation Network Reaches Record Active Audience Levels
items.summary: Sony's financial report for October-December 2025 reveals the PlayStation Network has hit a record active audience, with key highlights from the gaming division.

items.title: Valve Delays Steam Machine and Steam Frame Launch Due to RAM Shortage
items.summary: Valve has delayed pricing and shipping announcements for its new Steam Machine console-like PC and Steam Frame VR headset due to a RAM shortage.

items.title: Rockstar Confirms No Generative AI Used in GTA VI Creative Process
items.summary: Generative AI was not used in the creative development of GTA VI, though it remains in use for Rockstar's internal processes.

items.title: Sid Meier's Civilization VII and Retrocade Release Today on Mobile
items.summary: Upcoming mobile games launching February 5, 2026, include Sid Meier's Civilization VII from 2K and Retrocade from Resolution Games.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Over a million people losing power during snowstorm while data centers consume massive electricity
items.summary: A freezing snowstorm is causing widespread power outages affecting over a million people, while nearby data centers continue to consume significant electricity. The terms of data center agreements with local governments and utilities often remain unavailable to the public.

items.title: IonQ disputes short-seller claims over undisclosed revenue issues
items.summary: Quantum computing company IonQ is responding to allegations from short-seller Wolfpack Research that it misled investors about cancelled government earmarks and suspicious insider stock sales.

items.title: Crypto crime-fighting startup TRM Labs reaches $1 billion valuation
items.summary: TRM Labs, a cryptocurrency crime-fighting startup, achieved unicorn status with a new $70 million funding round, bringing its valuation to $1 billion.

items.title: Nevada legislators blast Boring Company over safety and environmental violations
items.summary: Nevada legislators criticized Elon Musk's Boring Company for safety and environmental violations. The company declined to testify at a legislative hearing on the matter.

items.title: Disney, HP, and PayPal announce CEO changes
items.summary: Three major technology and consumer companies—Disney, HP, and PayPal—are undergoing leadership transitions with new CEO appointments.
